Title.evidence: The GAP Study: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: multicenter, double-blinded, placebo-controlled randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Adults undergoing major cardiac, thoracic, or abdominal surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive gabapentin (600 mg preoperatively, 300 mg twice daily for 2 days postoperatively) or placebo

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated its effectiveness in major surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the length of hospital stay, measured from the end of surgery to discharge.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by surgical specialty and site, using a secure internet-based system with permuted blocks.

Blinding.evidence: Participants, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between April 2018 and May 2022, 1,196 participants were randomised (600 gabapentin, 596 placebo).

Number_Analysed.evidence: The study was analysed using an intention-to-treat approach.

Harms.evidence: Serious adverse events occurred in 189/600 (31.5%) gabapentin and 195/596 (32.7%) placebo participants.

Funding.evidence: funded by the UK National Institute for Health Research.
